review_body: The app's performance is amazing, love using it on my phone and PC. Ever since the new update came it asks me to sign into my education account, as my account is classed as a child but I do not have an education account. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app many times, and it was makin...Full ReviewThe app's performance is amazing, love using it on my phone and PC. Ever since the new update came it asks me to sign into my education account, as my account is classed as a child but I do not have an education account. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app many times, and it was making no difference. My other apps, like Drive and Sheets have done nothing like this. If I log in to education with my Gmail it says the account already exists, but it won't let me access it. 16/04/2020

Overall, great! I think the mobile app needs "Page setup" options like the web version, including the ability to change page color. BUG: April 16, 2020: Recent update keeps asking me to sign in whenever I open the Docs app. Yet, it says "Account already exists on this device." Very annoying and dist...Full ReviewOverall, great! I think the mobile app needs "Page setup" options like the web version, including the ability to change page color. BUG: April 16, 2020: Recent update keeps asking me to sign in whenever I open the Docs app. Yet, it says "Account already exists on this device." Very annoying and disturbs usage.

It was great until the update. Now, it's okay. We never had to sign in before, so why now? When I do attempt to sign in, an "account already exists" message appears. Then when I try to get out, it crashes. Only when I reopen the app am I able to use it.

The new update broke the app. Every time I try to open the app, or open a Doc from my Drive, it asks me to sign in . When I enter my email address, it says that account is already set up on my device, and it won't let me access my Docs. It was working fine last night, and apparently updated overnigh...Full ReviewThe new update broke the app. Every time I try to open the app, or open a Doc from my Drive, it asks me to sign in . When I enter my email address, it says that account is already set up on my device, and it won't let me access my Docs. It was working fine last night, and apparently updated overnight. Now I have this problem as of this morning. I tried everything short of removing and restoring my account from my phone. Very unhappy user.

While it's nice to see it can open OpenOffice odt files it failed to display a document correctly: it contains a picture with applied filter (grayscale) and superimposed text in a layout box. The web view showed the text followed by the picture with colors. The print view broke lines differently fro...Full ReviewWhile it's nice to see it can open OpenOffice odt files it failed to display a document correctly: it contains a picture with applied filter (grayscale) and superimposed text in a layout box. The web view showed the text followed by the picture with colors. The print view broke lines differently from OpenOffice, the text was displayed correctly above the image but the grayscale filter wasn't applied. Only three stars for this little experience.

I'm highly impressed with this app. Such an amazing app that help me to edit my documents, like I can change the text's fonts, style or size, as well as now I can insert any image in the docs which is highly unprecedented feature for me. Glad to have the app. Thank you 😊

Good app overall, but right now it's broken. Whenever I open it, it asks me to login and when I do it, it says my account is already logged into the account. So I have to close it open it again and it stops... Until I close it again.

It would be much convenient for us to be able to put our documents into a folder, sometimes I can't find the documents I want because the ones that are od the same topic are not in one place, even if I group them then I'll have to go to Google drive. Waste time.
It amazing! I love it it's easy to make stories and take notes easier. You can make documents and share to your friends to edit!

I give it a 3 star because it could use some updates, but at the same time it will not sync whenever I go to my phone's menu, account, sync now, and this one (Google Docs) is the only one that will not sync and update. Also, it seams like I have to absolutely save after I complete every single little step in creating my document/documents. "Save It!" After Every Single Letter.. Every Single Period! Or Else you will Loose it! Your supposed to save it as you go along anyways..But.. Not That Often!

My biggest irritation is how there is no special characters option. The only way I can put them in is if I'm writing on my phone because that's an option on my phone, not the app. So I am SOL when using my laptop.

05/19/2019 I just reduced from five stars to three stars. I edit a document, saved a document and then it prints the old document before edit. I can't find anything in the instructions to fix this problem. Excellent app. Does everything I want for creating, saving, editing and printing short documen...Full Review05/19/2019 I just reduced from five stars to three stars. I edit a document, saved a document and then it prints the old document before edit. I can't find anything in the instructions to fix this problem. Excellent app. Does everything I want for creating, saving, editing and printing short documents from my Android phone to my wifi-connected printer. Now reduced to two stars. When I edit a document the cursor goes from where I wanted to somewhere else. Lots of bugs.

There is a bug. When I delete some text, usually when it's in a list, like 1 to 10, instead of deleting the text, the cursor will bring me to a random text in the document and delete that one instead. It will also "summon" the text I desired to delete, to the said random location. This is happening ...Full ReviewThere is a bug. When I delete some text, usually when it's in a list, like 1 to 10, instead of deleting the text, the cursor will bring me to a random text in the document and delete that one instead. It will also "summon" the text I desired to delete, to the said random location. This is happening too frequently and frustrating. I had go back to the desired location and delete again but sometimes it will happen numerous of times until I get it right. Please have this fix. Thank you.

I'll start out by saying that Google Docs used to be my favorite writing app. It was easy to use, the files were easy to share, the site itself was easily navigatable, it was awesome. NOT ANY MORE. The most recent update killed the app. If I could give it a zero star rating I would. And some...Full ReviewI've had this app for literal years and I have never had any issue with it. That is until recently. The past few updates have made typing on a doc kind of buggy. I love this app and I have alot of stuff on my google account. I would love to continue using it but it's starting to get really annoying.

It was working okay for a time. But it constantly jumped to different areas of the page and dragging the last 5 seconds of text with it. The app insists on saving every file to Google Drive even though I don't want it to. It also wants to save every new file before it's titled. Then it doesn't delete the empty file it made before it was named. Before you know it, you have dozens of empty .doc files lying on your Google Drive account.

Wow! This is awesome! I really love this app, I love the cute fonts and everything. Bravo! I recommend this instead of other apps. Opened it and there were all my files backed up 🙂. I definitely recommend you try it. Does exactly what it says on the tin. So good Google acquired it.

This is my go to for writing any chapters for stories. Like it easily backs it all up so I don't have to worry about manually backing it up. It's very good with offline abilities too. Usually I have had apps crash or lag on me but this app did not do either. Quick on the go tools you can use as well...Full ReviewThis is my go to for writing any chapters for stories. Like it easily backs it all up so I don't have to worry about manually backing it up. It's very good with offline abilities too. Usually I have had apps crash or lag on me but this app did not do either. Quick on the go tools you can use as well as a few fonts. One small flaw and that is when I try to sometimes copy a specific section it won't let me. That has only happened to me a few time though.

Google Docs is a fantastic Word Processor if you don't feel like shelling out big bucks to Microsoft Word. Even better, you'll never lose your work - not one word - because everything is saved to the cloud. You can work locally too, but I really like the ability to move from one device to another se...Full ReviewGoogle Docs is a fantastic Word Processor if you don't feel like shelling out big bucks to Microsoft Word. Even better, you'll never lose your work - not one word - because everything is saved to the cloud. You can work locally too, but I really like the ability to move from one device to another seamlessly, working on the same document (ditto for Google Sheets). All this also means it is easy to share documents with another person (or you could even work together on it). Awesome technology!

I love this app. I use it everyday to write, make lists, etc. The fact that multiple people can be on and edit a document at once is incredibly useful, especially for things like shopping lists and school notes. Unfortunately, the app can only open and functionally edit documents that are less than ...Full ReviewI love this app. I use it everyday to write, make lists, etc. The fact that multiple people can be on and edit a document at once is incredibly useful, especially for things like shopping lists and school notes. Unfortunately, the app can only open and functionally edit documents that are less than a certain word count. I've noticed it gets glitchy around 40,000 words. There's also less ability to format than on desktop and I've had some issues with the app crashing multiple times in succession.

Frustrating isn't the word... why is it that Google have decided to make this application totally NOT intuitive. I can fully understand the need to not make a carbon copy of MS, but why the f### is it such an awkward piece of software?! Google docs for mobile is very useful, I can edit things on the fly or if my computer isn't available for some reason. The reason that this isn't getting 4 or 5 stars is one glaring issue that has been pissing me off for ages: there is no way to create actual paragraphs. The only 'tab' functionality...Full ReviewGoogle docs for mobile is very useful, I can edit things on the fly or if my computer isn't available for some reason. The reason that this isn't getting 4 or 5 stars is one glaring issue that has been pissing me off for ages: there is no way to create actual paragraphs. The only 'tab' functionality in this app tabs an entire block of text over, and won't let one line be tabbed over. This feature has been absent for 5 YEARS. I think it is sad that google has overlooked such a simple feature.

I have to force stop the a...Full ReviewThe convenience of this service is tremendous however I have a persistent notification that says "Docs is making x number of files available offline". It never goes away, even after disabling the offline features. Not even disabling background activity for Docs stops this. I have to force stop the application, every time, to get the notification to go away. Internet connection is fine, my phone is fine, my sanity is not. Please provide a clear answer, or fix this bug. It's so so annoying.

This app is clearly one of the best document editing apps there is, not including Microsoft Word. I love the added features that it offers the user, such as real time editing and notes. However, why I gave 4 stars is because there's one downgrade here: there's no dark theme. And I get, it's supposed...Full ReviewThis app is clearly one of the best document editing apps there is, not including Microsoft Word. I love the added features that it offers the user, such as real time editing and notes. However, why I gave 4 stars is because there's one downgrade here: there's no dark theme. And I get, it's supposed to be on a white theme because the default text option is black. However, this doesn't mean that you can't just add a dark theme and reverse the colors white and black. It would be a useful feature

I have come to use this for a few stories and it is very good. However there is one major flaw: the copy and paste is awful. It. Is not always reliable and reminds you about the crtl keys constantly when it fails to work. It really frustrates me. Please get rid of it.

This...Full ReviewDocs is wonderful but it has several areas that need improvement. The top 3: - you cannot make paragraph indentations in the app. This is very limiting, for formatting. - sharing: you cannot change the sharing settings to allow for "comments only" the way you can in the desktop version of Docs. That way, unless you remember the name of the doc, it takes forever to find anything, like on a desk with hundred of unsorted pieces of paper. — A scary preview of the time when algorithms determine everything, disregarding rhyme or reason. — Information from dictionaries and up-to-date grammar books never made it into algorithms, language experts were not consulted. — “Voice typing” reproduces other users’ mistakes. Ignorant of American / British English spellings (e. g. “color” — “colour”). — Replaces words / strings of words not said with frequently used ones. — Randomly capitalizes words in English, ignores all capitalization rules, especially in German. — Ignorant of German quotation marks. Omits € put in from European keyboards. — Rare punctuation marks not known. — I sometimes write an email in docs, then paste it into Thunderbird. Often I then edit it in Thunderbird. When I try to paste the new version into docs, docs simply uses the old clipboard. When I use "paste without formating" the new version appears. These errors have been there for years. Not getting fixed. —

Google Docs is a functional web based word processor, which is wonderful for on-the-go-edits or for when you need something exported into a very specific file type. However, this being a Google product I expect a little more than basic function. I truly find the lack of an innate folder system in Go...Full ReviewGoogle Docs is a functional web based word processor, which is wonderful for on-the-go-edits or for when you need something exported into a very specific file type. However, this being a Google product I expect a little more than basic function. I truly find the lack of an innate folder system in Google Docs frustrating and tiresome. Yes, you can make folders in their parallel product Google Drive and sort them there, but it's a horrendously convoluted experience that is not intuitive from a user experience standpoint. It took me a whole day to figure out that if I wanted to create a document that started in a folder innately (instead of being clumped together on my google drive landing age/ folder) I would have to use Google drive, select Google Docs from the right-click drop-down menu, and write away. I understand that it is a functional means by which to write documents, but there should truly be a more coherent method to do it from Google Docs.

I use this for note taking in school, since carrying a lighter Android device is much easier than a fullblown laptop. For that matter I also got myself a small physical keyboard and I have to say, the workflow with it is great. Everything is working out just fine except one thing: The <, > or | key, located next to "Y" in the German QWERTZ layout, doesn't work at all no matter how many times I press it. Fine in every other app but Google Docs. Reason why it bothers me so much is that without ">" I cannot create arrows that require me to type "-->", which you do a LOT when taking notes to symbolize implications. Fix that, then there will be 4 Stars. Let me save locally in any given folder without using Google Drive, then 5 Stars.

it's great, but it seems like a tease at the same time by adding certain features which just enough to create a simple document w/o complex formatting. we need complexity. for example, we can insert table, but not format them?! could you give us the option to finally remove the before and after line...Full Reviewit's great, but it seems like a tease at the same time by adding certain features which just enough to create a simple document w/o complex formatting. we need complexity. for example, we can insert table, but not format them?! could you give us the option to finally remove the before and after line spacing? also, I'm sure you all have to realize you should make the format toolbar just like the pixel app drawer where users just swipe up to reveal the menu, instead of reaching way up the screen.

everything was good when I first started using this app. I really love it! However it has been buggy lately. When I start typing it goes all haywire and started typing a bunch of random words. However it has been buggy lately. When I start typing it goes all haywire and started typing a bunch of random words. I really enjoy the mobile app, the style is nice. But a recurring problem for the offline document feature, is that it takes ages to download my documents, for offline use, or editing. On both my Chromebook and android phone, a problem of the app crashing, or 'Not Responding' persists. It would be amazing if these problems were fixed to make the app run more smooth, and efficiently. I would recommend this app, and I appreciate, that it is free unlike similar apps, or software such as Microsoft Word. Keep up the good work, but please do better.

It used to work pretty well and I love being able to check and edit my documents easily, but lately it's been annoying. I don't know if this problem has happened with anyone else, but it just started a couple months ago for me and hasn't gotten any better.

I may be a bit biased but hey So I use Google docs all the time. I'm one of those people with lots of docs with unfinished ideas and story's, and docs is my go to place! Just being able to easily switch between documents and always being able to check the word count really helps a lot! Just being able to easily switch between documents and always being able to check the word count really helps a lot! And since it's a Google product I don't need to make any new accounts, just get in, write it out, and be done! Sorry for rambling a bit, I just really like Google docs!

Its simplicity is its saving grace. But thanks to all the bugs, trying to get stuff done on this app can be like pulling teeth. But thanks to all the bugs, trying to get stuff done on this app can be like pulling teeth. For example: -It tries to be "smart" with its auto corrections, and just makes a mess of your text. - It closes down when you try to copy and paste. - for an offline app it acts like it runs on dial up. - It suffers from not being able to preform basic, common sense, functionality. Even though that's the heart and soul of a document app. PLEASE keep debugging this app

I use an older model of android, and have been using it for years now. I did a factory reset on my device in a last ditch effort to get rid of unrelated code errors and now I cannot reinstall the app, because in its current form its incompatible. I am deeply annoyed and also upset, as all my writing...Full ReviewI use an older model of android, and have been using it for years now. I did a factory reset on my device in a last ditch effort to get rid of unrelated code errors and now I cannot reinstall the app, because in its current form its incompatible. I am deeply annoyed and also upset, as all my writing was on this app and no longer being able to access it as readily is going to put a severe cramp in my writing onwards. I don't know why they had to trash the old code that made this app usable and it's extremely discouraging.
It's a very good app, but keeps crashing when I am supposed to paste certain text copied in the clipboard from other sources. Please fix it.
The day Docs gets "Dark Mode" as an option is the day I give it 5 stars -- functionality is perfect for me, but it hurts my eyes when I'm working in the middle of the night!

This app is good as it is but can actually be better if one is able to post documents created from here direct to social media outlets like WhatsApp, Facebook, twitter etc. For now, that feature is not existent!

Enjoyable but a bit tedious Docs has everything i need for writing down notes on the fly or writing down short stories that I can expand upon when I get home. But when I'm trying to share it with others it gets annoying since i have to enable link sharing then share it instead of just hitting share. But when I'm trying to share it with others it gets annoying since i have to enable link sharing then share it instead of just hitting share. It's like if you had to unlock your door and then hit a button and then open it. I also don't like how I can't click on a doc and then just edit it I have to hit the edit button. Overall tho it's pretty good

As someone who takes notes excessively when learning anything, this app is a godsend for organization and keeping the notes in tact without paper damage. Cloud notes means you never lose them. The only thing I wish was for the text options to be more efficient. Having the option menu you get on the ...Full ReviewAs someone who takes notes excessively when learning anything, this app is a godsend for organization and keeping the notes in tact without paper damage. Cloud notes means you never lose them. The only thing I wish was for the text options to be more efficient. Having the option menu you get on the desktop version always on the side and easy to use would be nice. Either way I can always polish my notes when switching to desktop, so I'm satisfied.

Docs has proven quite useful for writing, primarily because of it's real time collaborative functionality and simple cloud saving. Where Docs falls behind is in it's formatting capabilities. If the following functionalities exist, I apolagize. This is what I find to be missing or difficult to use: l...Full ReviewDocs has proven quite useful for writing, primarily because of it's real time collaborative functionality and simple cloud saving. Where Docs falls behind is in it's formatting capabilities. If the following functionalities exist, I apolagize. This is what I find to be missing or difficult to use: line spacing, custom page dimensions, inserting a background, predictive formatting, app background themes, multiple columns, and more. I would pay for a version of docs with these aditional functions.

Useful little app I'm a writer, so a good, reliable writing app is very very important part of my life. Only down side for me though is it's haven't really ready to spot the com...Full ReviewI'm a writer, so a good, reliable writing app is very very important part of my life. On top it is easy to use, I can share my files with other people, we both can work on the same document and all that from nearly any device. Only down side for me though is it's haven't really ready to spot the common errors in my grammar on my own language, but it's something can be updated soon hopefully.

This app is very good for simple documenting that mostly involves text. However, more advanced features don't exist such as charts and text boxes. Great, lacks 1 anecdotal feature. I like it, you can type across multiple devices no matter where you are. It has advantages over word just as word has advantages over it. The docs app is more mobile than the word app. I definitely prefer it to word with how I use it. The problem comes when I hook a keyboard and mouse to my phone (note 9). When I click it doesnt work on somethings and the scroll wheel doesn't work when in the app. I like using my phone instead of my laptop, but might use word.

I have one issue. If there's a way to select multiple files and delete them, that'...Full ReviewI have one issue. When you permanently delete files in the bin, it shows the "Item was permanently deleted" tab below that covers the "Delete forever" button so it's kind of a hindrance when you try to delete files in quick succession. If there's a way to select multiple files and delete them, that'd be great. otherwise, you could just move that tab somewhere else.

It can be pretty good, but then it can also be trash. I like the fact that zooms on the text of the document more than Microsoft Word, so it makes it more mobile friendly. But where it really sucks is in how long it takes to save the document and load it (even though it is opening a book-long docume...Full ReviewIt can be pretty good, but then it can also be trash. I like the fact that zooms on the text of the document more than Microsoft Word, so it makes it more mobile friendly. But where it really sucks is in how long it takes to save the document and load it (even though it is opening a book-long document, it should be much faster), and what is especially annoying, and this has happened twice where I've had to uninstall and reinstall it to get the feature back, is that I lose the ability to copy.

A very handy app for writing in general. One problem, however. Whenever I type a word with an apostrophe (') in it, why does the apostrophe get instantly deleted? The only workaround that I have so far is to write the whole word first, then add the apostrophe after - kinda bothersome, but that's all...Full ReviewA very handy app for writing in general. One problem, however. Whenever I type a word with an apostrophe (') in it, why does the apostrophe get instantly deleted? The only workaround that I have so far is to write the whole word first, then add the apostrophe after - kinda bothersome, but that's all. Thank you and I hope you fix this devs!

This was a life saver for me. I absolutely had to have the Times New Roman font but other so called free word processors wanted me to pay extra for it. I'm thinking of Office Suite who pretend it's my tablet's fault for not having that font when in fact they just want to charge me extra for it. Same...Full ReviewThis was a life saver for me. I absolutely had to have the Times New Roman font but other so called free word processors wanted me to pay extra for it. I'm thinking of Office Suite who pretend it's my tablet's fault for not having that font when in fact they just want to charge me extra for it. Same with Microsoft Word, but at least that doesn't pretend to be a free office suite like the other one does. Google Docs, on the other hand, includes all the fonts you need and doesn't ask for extra payment. Superb.

author_name: Dr. Timothy Ramos Sr BS FIAMA LAc DiHom DC
review_body: Please remove the automatic syn on recent files. It is checked/default on install.

Extremely useful and convenient. I can make a document on my laptop, edit it later on my phone, then write some more from my friend's computer just by logging in. Google Docs is the Best! I use this app for recipes, my monthly bills and even writing short stories. I never have to worry about losing a doc because my phone broke or my computer died. Awesome app that has never failed me in the several years that I have been using it... since it came out.

Really convenient app without any doubt, although that seems like an axiom at this point,I still find this app a little basic for my liking. Perfect I love this app and find it very useful for setting up and organizing family holidays for the extended family. I recommend using it with google drive for a better, easier experience. And best of all it's entirely FREE!!!

Word no more. While my "Word" blinks at me, only wanting to remind me to resubscribe to Microsoft Office, I'm reminded how free I am with Docs. Sure is Word "the best" for whatever technical reason you could give? Maybe. But the same could be said of cars, if you're not in a Bentley could you call it a car? The "...Full ReviewWhile my "Word" blinks at me, only wanting to remind me to resubscribe to Microsoft Office, I'm reminded how free I am with Docs. Sure is Word "the best" for whatever technical reason you could give? Maybe. But the same could be said of cars, if you're not in a Bentley could you call it a car? The "advantages" of Word, don't outweigh the freedom Docs has given me. And to think, how much a month do I pay for this? How much does office want for theirs? I haven't lost a thing, and gained much more!

Decent but clunky and has a few glitches. Also the app gives no options what-so-ever in the realms of organization amongst folders. The fact that you can not create, edit, or delete a folder or folders is irritating. Oh, and the "Most Recently Opened" Docs makes it a hassle. Just revamp and streamline the whole thing. Please?

This app... gets the job done. That's about all I can say about it. I have it on multiple devices. Sadly, it works better on PC, especially with extentions. The bugs I've encountered on mobile range from selecting text for deletion only to somehow skip to a much earlier segment and have the equivale...Full ReviewThis app... gets the job done. That's about all I can say about it. I have it on multiple devices. Sadly, it works better on PC, especially with extentions. The bugs I've encountered on mobile range from selecting text for deletion only to somehow skip to a much earlier segment and have the equivalent amount of text deleted, to the unwanted offline downloads others are complaining about that seriously eats up data. Needs bug fixes, a night mode and additional folders for document organisation.

This app is brilliant; invaluable! but it makes me incredibly nervous. The app has crashed, losing at one time around 450 words of referenced, acedemic work. comedic short stories (2 of them)- gone for no reason. its so well made, i don't want to stop using it, but...

As a student I didn't want one more app to occupy space on my phone and was skeptical about it initially However after using it for some time I can conclude that It's good for students who are often required to work on group assignment. The .doc file can be converted into a variety of other extensio...Full ReviewAs a student I didn't want one more app to occupy space on my phone and was skeptical about it initially However after using it for some time I can conclude that It's good for students who are often required to work on group assignment. The .doc file can be converted into a variety of other extensions and can be easily shared. The best part of the whole app as well as the desktop website is that, you don't need to save all the time, everything is saved on real time basis. It's actually very impressive!

I would really want to give a 5-star review... If it did the basics of what it says it provides! It takes about triple the time it should (compared to word) to backspace a mini paragraph (3 lines). Then when I'm going to type something, it glitches around and begins typing all over the place. Perfect Everything works just right, and almost all the options I have on the computer version are also available on mobile; there are several missing functions, but anything done on one version is formatted the same, or very nearly the same, on the other, and the mobile version is great for continuing on d...Full ReviewEverything works just right, and almost all the options I have on the computer version are also available on mobile; there are several missing functions, but anything done on one version is formatted the same, or very nearly the same, on the other, and the mobile version is great for continuing on documents right where I left off when I don't have my computer available. The mobile version also makes any docs you open available offline on your phone or tablet, so you can keep working and let it update later.

Unfortunatley, i have to give this app a 3 star rating. It lets you edit and write pretty well, but there is one major bug. As an example: Hello, i ...Full ReviewUnfortunatley, i have to give this app a 3 star rating. It lets you edit and write pretty well, but there is one major bug. If you are writing something and you go to edit a mistake, it will join that word and some other words around it and even change what some of them are. As an example: Hello, i am Elijah. I want to edit that to Hello, I am Elijah. Instead it will do this: Helloionelijah. I want this fixed please. I know things take time but your reputation precedes this. Thank you.

Inconsistent picture quality Sometimes when I take a picture and press ok to say "I like this picture quality" it will show up very squiggly to the point I cant read it. But it isnt consistent. I need clear pictures I use this app to take notes for class. Other than that the app works fine but that is a big factor.

In my opinion, it's probably the best mobile app for documents that you can find out there, especially considering how extensive the add-on capabilities are.

I can open the Google Docs app on my phone to write my ideas. I can retrieve the ideas that I wrote and open the app on my tablet to make changes or continue writing. I love this app. Thanks Google for this app. It has saved my life!!

I created our business brochure with slides.

Compared to other applications, such a Microsoft Word, the pricing of the software is defiantly great for what it provides. Versatile and helpful! My computer broke last semester and docs has made it great to edit anywhere. I can access it from my iPad to my school's computer to my phone. Makes things really efficient and easy! I do notice that in the Docs app, things are streamlined and some interfaces get left out (like a header without page...Full ReviewMy computer broke last semester and docs has made it great to edit anywhere. I can access it from my iPad to my school's computer to my phone. Makes things really efficient and easy! I do notice that in the Docs app, things are streamlined and some interfaces get left out (like a header without page counts, margrin control/tab control goes wonky sometimes). However I am very happy with docs.

Fathomless silo for your data grains Google docs is indeed a fathomless silo where you can store your data grains without worrying. It's an invisible lock that everybody wished for their secret info. People need just one tool. I would rather write on papers and stack them on racks, than using different maniac tools. This is a milestone...Full ReviewGoogle docs is indeed a fathomless silo where you can store your data grains without worrying. It's an invisible lock that everybody wished for their secret info. People need just one tool. I would rather write on papers and stack them on racks, than using different maniac tools. This is a milestone for digitalization. GD is an umbrella available when it's raining and disappears when you don't need it. I can't think of anything better than this because there is none.

Google docs in general is amazing, but the Android app is very glitchy, and tends to crash when you try to open a document. I've been sending feedback about every third time it happens for the past couple months, and it's gotten a little better, but it still happens often.

Typing is so buggy in the app. Lately after some updates it's worse. Or if I make an edit, the cursor may randomly jump up to the top of the page and start...Full ReviewTyping is so buggy in the app. Lately after some updates it's worse. I may type out a word and be halfway through then the app will somehow delete the first half of the word and only leave the last few characters. Or if I make an edit, the cursor may randomly jump up to the top of the page and start typing in a random place (the only workaround I found is to press 'space' before I type anything else then backspace out the extra space). I love google docs on my desktop but the app is frustrating.

The app is horribly crippled compared to the desktop version. I can see why such a cut-down version might be good on a wimpy phone. Fonts are limited to a very, very small selection.

I love love love this app! Everything I need is on here. It's integrated with the power of Google and you can highlight words and phrases and then hit explore to research. I love that feature. It's not giant and cumbersome, it's light and fast. I'm very happy with Google docs and I hope it never goe...Full ReviewI love love love this app! Everything I need is on here. I'm very happy with Google docs and I hope it never goes away. Please don't take anything away from this wonderful app, keep adding! Make it even better! I support you!!!

I had been totally enjoying this app until the past week. When I open it up it will not fully load and then crashes with a message "Google docs has closed unexpectantly". This problem is intermittent. It sometimes works fine and I'm on automatic updates, last updated Sept 6. When I open it up it will not fully load and then crashes with a message "Google docs has closed unexpectantly". This problem is intermittent. It sometimes works fine and I'm on automatic updates, last updated Sept 6. I do not have more than recommended storage on the app, and I'd love to keep using it. Hoping the bug works itself out. Help!

Very useful! Really good when you have a Google Docs document open on your desktop computer, and you open the same document using the Docs app on your phone. You can then hold up your phone, touch the microphone icon on the keyboard and speak, and essentially voice type onto the document. The change...Full ReviewVery useful! Really good when you have a Google Docs document open on your desktop computer, and you open the same document using the Docs app on your phone. You can then hold up your phone, touch the microphone icon on the keyboard and speak, and essentially voice type onto the document. The changes will instantly appear on the desktop version of the document. A powerful voice-dictation tool for writing quickly when you have a document to create!

Great on Other Platforms but Avg at Best on a phone. The mobile app, which is required instead of the chrome based version, is severely limited. You can type in it and print and for notes, that's fine. However if you actually want to edit the document appearance, adjust margins, fonts, etc, the feat...Full ReviewGreat on Other Platforms but Avg at Best on a phone. The mobile app, which is required instead of the chrome based version, is severely limited. You can type in it and print and for notes, that's fine. However if you actually want to edit the document appearance, adjust margins, fonts, etc, the features are simply not available. On PC & Chromebook, it's great. On a phone, not really. Mostly annoying for its limited usefulness.

I love google Docs because it automatically saves your work for one, and you can have many devices open at once and any changes you make to a document will automatically appear on all devices. Wonderful Tool For Us Writers! Love the Google Docs app. I'm a Horror writer and am working on several novels and Google Docs allows me to easily switch between them and has great editing and text tools, everything I need to write a great Horror Novel, not to mention the fact I can save all of my work online without having to wor...Full ReviewLove the Google Docs app. I'm a Horror writer and am working on several novels and Google Docs allows me to easily switch between them and has great editing and text tools, everything I need to write a great Horror Novel, not to mention the fact I can save all of my work online without having to worry about losing anything should my computer crash on me. . Thanks for creating an awesome writing app!!

An adequate adaptation for mobile Making a mobile version for Google Docs is an essential task, but tricky. And for what it's worth, I think this does the job just fine. The only thing that makes me hesitant to give it five stars is my own reservations about typing on a tiny screen. It just doesn't feel right to me.

Overall, I think the app functions well and is productive. However, I think one thing needs to be added, and that would be diagrams. However, I think one thing needs to be added, and that would be diagrams. They are available only on the desktop version of Google docs and not on the app, and some people may not be able to use the desktop version and may need to use a diagram in their assignment.

love google docs just due to how easy it is to transfer informatio from one device to the other, however, you should have a writing tool available for all to use. It wold make like so much easier. Also, might I suggest making it possible to give tables headings on the X and Y axsis?

Useful to type on the train with when there's not enough time to take out my laptop. Nice interface and functionality, has most pc version functions I need. Has a better spellchecker than my phone. This app is absolutely awful. When I opened a .docx file in it, it corrupted it immediately, reducing it to an apparently 0B file. Docs sometimes reads it anyway, but I can't even copy the text. Convenient and easy to use I really love using this app when I don't have access to a computer. I can also look up previous documents on my phone without having to search through lots...Full ReviewI really love using this app when I don't have access to a computer. This is a truly awful piece of software. I spend more than 50% of my time while using it wrestling with its aggressive auto formatting "features". To compound things further, I cant print or make PDF files from my chromebook as the formatting is different to every other machine. I have spent hours t...Full ReviewThis is a truly awful piece of software. I spend more than 50% of my time while using it wrestling with its aggressive auto formatting "features". To compound things further, I cant print or make PDF files from my chromebook as the formatting is different to every other machine. I have spent hours trying to figure out whats wrong to no avail. The collaboration features are great for raw text, but an Office 365 subscriptions and a return to a macbook is on the cards at this point.

Google Docs is indefinitely the runner-up to MS Word. The Docs UI is more user friendly than Word's, which unfortunately warrants a more limited experience. From font restrictions to simplified auto-correct, frustrating document outline and more, Docs can be difficult to work with for someone who is...Full ReviewGoogle Docs is indefinitely the runner-up to MS Word. The Docs UI is more user friendly than Word's, which unfortunately warrants a more limited experience. From font restrictions to simplified auto-correct, frustrating document outline and more, Docs can be difficult to work with for someone who is interested and perhaps needs such features. If you can get past such restrictions, however, coloboration is quite obviously where Google Docs shines. Sharing is simple and commenting is great.

this app is really great. I use it for everything really. I use it for reports, schedules, lists, pictures to people, and everything else. I love and it is amazing for everything. What I type and create using Microsoft word of power point I transfer to Google drive and convert into Docs or slides.

I solved the problem my changing the settings and also totally logging off one of my email but this can confuse many users.

review_body: I would say it is impressive how slow and laggy the mobile app is, but it's more worthy of horror. The performance is absolutely abysmal. The brow...Full ReviewI would say it is impressive how slow and laggy the mobile app is, but it's more worthy of horror. The performance is absolutely abysmal. Typing has on average a half second lag, with up to 1 second on a bad day. It takes some legendary poor coding to create something that runs so terribly. The browser version runs decently. So which drunk chimpanzee did they have code the mobile app?

UPDATE: As of the Sep 27th update (v1.19.392), I still can't recommend updating past v1.18.502. Like every other 1.19.x version, it's STILL redownloading every offline document every time you open the app and every time it syncs in the background instead of just redownloading the ones that have been updated, wasting data in the process. They don't even have the decency to use the v1.18.x behavior on the final notification to only show which ones had changes or disappear if none had any.

TEACHERS, WRITERS, BLOGGERS AND GRAPHIC DESIGNERS BEWARE! I just took my 5-Star rating down to a 3-Star because Google removed an important piece of the app's grammar intelligence. For some dumb reason, the very smart people at Google thought it was wise to remove the app's default (and now missing)...Full ReviewTEACHERS, WRITERS, BLOGGERS AND GRAPHIC DESIGNERS BEWARE! I just took my 5-Star rating down to a 3-Star because Google removed an important piece of the app's grammar intelligence. For some dumb reason, the very smart people at Google thought it was wise to remove the app's default (and now missing) intelligence about the proper use of quote marks and apostrophes. Now, rather than quote marks, it inserts the symbol for inches and the feet symbol for apostrophes and removed any way to fix it.
